page.title: 14BUCKLOW HILL
page.content: ONLY IN FLAT CHESHIRE COULD THIS AREA BE KNOWN AS A'HILL'BUT IT WAS A RALLYING POINT IN THE PAST AND THE CENTRE OF A LARGE ADMINISTRATIVE AREA.THE LAST REMNANT OF THIS IS PERHAPS THE TELEPHONE EXCHANGE. AT THE JUNCTION OF THE A556 AND A5034 ROADS THERE IS A LARGE GARAGE, A CAR SALES BUSINESS AND THE {SWAN HOTEL.} { MONTEBELLO CASTLE }IS A RAMBLING FOLLY OF A HOUSE ON THE A556, WITH TOWERS AND CRENELLATIONS, PROBABLY ADDED TO AN OLDER HOUSE WHEN A GREEK CONSUL LIVED THERE ABOUT 1885.IT IS TATTON ESTATE PROPERTY, RATHER DELAPIDATED AND NOW USED AS RIDING AND LIVERY STABLES FOR UP TO 30 HORSES, WITH A STAFF OF 5 OR 6. {JOHN WRIGHT ANS SONS} ARE BUSY AGRICULTURAL ENGINEERS ALSO RETAILING TRACTOR PARTS, TOOLS AND ACCESORIES.
